meal_plan:
## Weekly Vegetarian Meal Plan for Weight Loss (1243 kcal, 62g Protein, 155g Carbs, 41g Fat)

This meal plan is a suggestion and calorie/macro counts are estimates.  Adjust portion sizes to meet your individual needs and always consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian before starting any weight loss program.

**Day 1:**

| Meal          | Meal Name                     | Ingredients & Quantities                                      | Preparation Instructions                                                                  | Estimated Calories | Macros (P/C/F) | Notes                                      |
|---------------|------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------|-----------------|----------------------------------------------|
| Breakfast     | Oatmeal with Berries & Nuts   | ½ cup rolled oats, 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, ½ cup mixed berries, 1 tbsp chopped almonds | Cook oats according to package directions. Stir in almond milk and top with berries & nuts. | ~350 kcal          | 10g/60g/15g     | Use gluten-free oats if needed.                  |
| Morning Snack | Apple slices with Peanut Butter | 1 medium apple, 2 tbsp peanut butter                          | Slice apple and spread with peanut butter.                                              | ~200 kcal          | 7g/20g/12g     | Choose natural peanut butter without added sugar. |
| Lunch         | Lentil Soup with Whole-wheat Bread | 1.5 cups lentil soup (homemade or store-bought low-sodium), 1 slice whole-wheat bread | Reheat soup. Serve with bread.                                                           | ~400 kcal          | 15g/60g/10g     | Use gluten-free bread if needed.              |
| Evening Snack | Greek Yogurt with Chia Seeds  | 1 cup plain nonfat Greek yogurt, 1 tbsp chia seeds            | Combine yogurt and chia seeds.                                                            | ~150 kcal          | 15g/10g/5g      |                                              |
| Dinner        | Vegetable Curry with Brown Rice | 1.5 cups vegetable curry (using chickpeas, spinach, cauliflower, etc.), ½ cup brown rice | Prepare curry according to recipe (focus on low-sodium, low-oil). Serve with rice.       | ~343 kcal          | 15g/55g/8g      | Use coconut milk sparingly for creaminess.       |


**Day 2 - Day 7:**  Follow a similar pattern, varying the vegetables, legumes, and grains to prevent boredom and ensure nutritional diversity.  Examples include:

* **Day 2:** Quinoa salad with black beans, corn, and avocado; Chickpea pasta with marinara sauce; Tofu scramble with veggies;  Cottage cheese with fruit.
* **Day 3:**  Vegetable stir-fry with brown rice; Lentil and vegetable stew;  Spiced chickpeas and sweet potato;  Almonds and a banana.
* **Day 4:**  Breakfast burrito with scrambled tofu, black beans, and salsa;  Hummus and veggie sticks;  Vegetable soup with a side salad;  Edamame pods.
* **Day 5:**  Overnight oats with berries and seeds;  Hard-boiled eggs (2);  Vegetarian chili with whole-wheat crackers;  Air-popped popcorn.
* **Day 6:**  Spinach and feta omelet (use a dairy-free alternative if needed);  Rice cakes with avocado;  Pasta primavera with vegetables;  Plain yogurt with fruit.
* **Day 7:**  Smoothie with spinach, banana, almond milk, and protein powder;  Trail mix (nuts, seeds, dried fruit - in moderation);  Buddha bowl with roasted vegetables, quinoa, and tahini dressing;  Dark chocolate (small square).


**Detailed Grocery List:**


**Produce:**

* Apples: 3 medium
* Bananas: 2
* Berries (mixed): 3 cups (fresh or frozen)
* Spinach: 1 large container
* Cauliflower: 1 head
* Sweet potato: 2 medium
* Avocado: 2
* Onion: 1 large
* Garlic: 1 head
* Corn: 2 ears
* Carrots: 1 bunch
* Broccoli: 1 head
* Bell peppers (various colors): 2
* Tomatoes: 1 pint cherry
* Cucumber: 1


**Proteins (Plant-based):**

* Rolled oats: 1 container (gluten-free if needed)
* Lentils (brown or green): 1 cup (dried)
* Chickpeas: 2 cans
* Black beans: 2 cans
* Peanut butter: 1 jar (natural, no added sugar)
* Tofu: 1 block (firm)
* Chia seeds: 1 container
* Quinoa: 1 cup (dried)
* Protein powder (vegetarian): 1 container (optional)


**Dairy and Alternatives:**

* Unsweetened almond milk: 1 carton
* Plain nonfat Greek yogurt: 2 containers
* Cottage cheese (low-fat): 1 container (optional)
* Feta cheese (dairy-free option available):  Small container (optional)


**Grains and Bread:**

* Whole-wheat bread: 1 loaf (gluten-free if needed)
* Brown rice: 1 cup (dried)
* Quinoa: 1 cup (dried)
* Chickpea pasta: 1 box
* Rice cakes: 1 package


**Pantry Items:**

* Olive oil
* Coconut milk (canned, light): 1 can
* Spices (curry powder, cumin, turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper)
* Salsa
* Hummus
* Tahini


**Snacks and Treats:**

* Almonds: 1 cup
* Trail mix (nuts, seeds, dried fruit - check sugar content): 1 bag (small)
* Dark chocolate (70% cacao or higher): 1 small bar


**Beverages:**

* Water


**Notes:** This grocery list provides a general guideline. You may need to adjust quantities based on your preferences and the specific recipes you choose.  Remember to prioritize fresh, whole foods whenever possible.  This is a sample plan and individual needs may vary, consult a dietitian or nutritionist for a personalized plan.
